p: Complementary to epidemiological surveillance, environmental surveillance is recommended for vector control [ 6]. This requires considering numerous multisectoral aspects, as many environmental and socioeconomic factors have been linked to the breeding of A. Aegypti. These can be related to the climate and man-made urban environments, such as the presence of stagnant water in houses and abandoned buildings, and inadequate water, sanitation systems, and waste management [ 21, 22, 23].
